testsuite.name: ContactsTest

testcase.name: start

failure.message:
java.lang.AssertionError: Exception in test #6
Probably you have nextInt() (or similar Scanner method) followed by nextLine() - in this situation nextLine() often gives an empty string and another one nextLine() call gives correct string.
java.util.InputMismatchException at java.base/java.util.Scanner.throwFor(Scanner.java:939) at java.base/java.util.Scanner.next(Scanner.java:1594) at java.base/java.util.Scanner.nextInt(Scanner.java:2258) at java.base/java.util.Scanner.nextInt(Scanner.java:2212) at contacts.Main.editARecord(Main.java:170) at contacts.Main.main(Main.java:76)
Please find below the output of your program during this failed test. Note that the '>' character indicates the beginning of the input line.
---
[menu] Enter action (add, list, search, count, exit): > add Enter the type (person, organization): > person Enter the name: > John Enter the surname: > Smith Enter the birth date: > Bad birth date! Enter the gender(M, F):> Bad gender! Enter the number: > 123 456 789 The record added.
[menu] Enter action (add, list, search, count, exit): > list 1. John Smith Enter index to show info: > 1 Name: John Surname: Smith Birth date: [no data] Gender: [no data] Number: 123 456 789 Time created: 2020-11-01T21:32:24.507788500 Time last edit: null
[menu] Enter action (add, list, search, count, exit): [menu] Enter action (add, list, search, count, exit): > edit 1. John Smith Select a record: > gender

testcase.failure:
java.lang.AssertionError: Exception in test #6
